pullRequest.body:
In the existing instance `Algebra R (AdicCompletion I R)`, `R` appears three times: On the left, on the right, and in `I : Ideal R`. The left occurrence can be generalised to a ring `S` such that `R` is a `S`-algebra.

Closes ImperialCollegeLondon/FLT/issues/230.

From FLT


---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

### PR summary [31397167bf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19466/commits/31397167bf4d225ae308f68db88ecb2dfd1fbf24)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instIsScalarTower`
`+ instSMul`
`+ instSMulCommClass`
`+ instance [Algebra S R] : Algebra S (AdicCompletion I R)`
`+ instance [Semiring S] [SMul S R] [Module S M] [IsScalarTower S R M] :`
`+ val_add_apply`
`+ val_neg`
`+ val_neg_apply`
`+ val_smul_apply`
`+ val_sub_apply`
`+ val_sum_apply`
`+ val_zero_apply`
`- instance : Algebra R (AdicCompletion I R)`
`- instance : Module R (AdicCompletion I M)`
`- instance : SMul R (AdicCompletion I M)`
`- instance : SMul ℕ (AdicCompletion I M)`
`- instance : SMul ℤ (AdicCompletion I M)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

I assume more precisely, you mean
```suggestion
the `Module (AdicCompletion I R) (AdicCompletion I M)` instance (see `AdicCompletion/Algebra`). -/
```
I assume so, but I haven't written this comment
Is there a way of telling github "try this way of thinking about the diff instead"?
The only way I know is to split the PR in two :/
I think this lemma and the next would be easier to read if you named the variable `(s : S)` not `(r : S)` because there is also an `R` here.
Do you think that instead of all this API it's better to make `AdicCompletion.val : AdicCompletion I M ->+ ((n : ℕ) → M ⧸ I ^ n • ⊤)`?
I think its usually better to have the unbundled spelling as the preferred form, and have the morphism around as well for assembling the non-refl proofs like `val_sum`.
Yes, I would rather keep `val` unbundled here. Also note that those lemmas should be stated anyway because they can be used by `dsimp`
If .val were an AddMonoidHom you'd get all this stuff for free, right?

This one no, since here `val` is applied to two arguments. The one above, yes, but you can already get it for "free" with `map_sum (incl _) _ _` or similar (where `incl` is the `AddMonoidHom` you're asking for)

nit:
```suggestion
    [IsScalarTower S R M] [IsScalarTower T R M] [IsScalarTower T S M] :
```
so that the "actually needed to prove this" argument is last.

as above:
```suggestion
    [IsScalarTower S R M] [IsScalarTower T R M] [SMulCommClass T S M] :
```

```suggestion
instance instSMulCommClass [SMul S R] [SMul T R] [SMul S M] [SMul T M]
    [IsScalarTower S R M] [IsScalarTower T R M] [SMulCommClass S T M] :
    SMulCommClass S T (AdicCompletion I M) where
```
so that these are ordered consistently.

```suggestion
instance instIsScalarTower [SMul S T] [SMul S R] [SMul T R] [SMul S M] [SMul T M]
    [IsScalarTower S R M] [IsScalarTower T R M] [IsScalarTower S T M] :
    IsScalarTower S T (AdicCompletion I M) where
  smul_assoc s t f := by ext; simp [val_smul]
```
Is an `IsCentralScalar` instance easy to add too, while you're here? The right actions refactor that drowned in Lean 3 requires one of these by every algebra instance.

pullRequest.title: chore(AdicCompletion): generalise algebra instance to separate rings
